website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a better deal with more features, we recommend the Big Wheel.
pros: Lots of features at a bargain price
cons: Some very small children might have trouble peddling it, but the price and features make it worth the adjustment period

customer_reviews.title: Born to be wild.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for my 2 yo son, he had to use it as a push along to start with, but now he is 3 he can reach the pedals. With the grow with me functions it will last for a long while, the only problem is that his picking up my bad driving habits. It is very stable so I feel happy that he will not fall off it easy and it is hardy enough to take the punishment dealt out by a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Birch

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I should've know better! This plastic bike sucks and I know it will end up in a landfill. I'm mad at myself for buying this plastic piece of crap. The wheels don't stick, the pedals are awkward, especially with the extenders. I wind up having to hunch down or use my foot to push my daughter around on the sidewalk. If she goes down a little slope, the thing immediately starts wobbling and looks like it's going to topple over. Terrible, terrible waste of money. I even put rubberized tape on the wheels and it still sucks. Save your hard earned money and buy a better trike!!
customer_reviews.author: Melina T.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful trike
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this bike. We got it for my son on his second birthday. He is 39" tall. The one thing to note is that he is unable to reach the petals in the first seat position and the orange blocks on the petals. My sons still just pushes it around with his feet on the ground and can keep up with us on our walks. I love the fact that it is a really light bike and easy for him to move around. I think this will be something we use for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lickin' and keeps on tickin'
customer_reviews.text: This thing is STURDY. My 3 year old has had it for a year and it's been put through the mill. It's been left out in the rain, thrown across cement patio, pounded on with drumsticks, dragged through the dirt and used as bumper cars with his sister's big wheel. All I do is hose it off and towel it down. I've not needed to tighten any screws or maintenance at all. It took my husband about 45 minutes to assemble it but that isn't because it's too terribly difficult to understand the directions. It's just that there are several steps and he's a perfectionist.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: This was a great buy. My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy. My son loves it! It was easy to put together. For having plastic wheels it's a pretty quiet ride on our rough concrete. My son will be 2 next month. He is tall for his age and still can't reach the pedals even with the extra extender on it. Which is good because he can grow into it. Would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good everyday trike.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 2.5 years old and 39" tall - very long legs. Her outside foot can't reach the pedals when she turns the handlebars. And that's with the extenders on the pedals and the seat moved all the way up. Wait until your child is at least 40" tall before buying. Also, the plastic tires have very little grip. Both my 2 and 4 year old were spinning their wheels on more than one occasion. We just ended up going to our local big box store and buying a Radio Flyer with rubber tires and a more appropriate sized frame for my daughter. This one is only used as a backup or an extra when friends come to play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great Trike for a Little Tyke!
customer_reviews.text: A great little trike for a little tyke! Simply and quick assembly. My little nephew loved this gift for his second birthday, and so did his friends. It was a great lesson in sharing! Well put together toy, I know he'll get a lot of use out of it!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey S.

customer_reviews.title: My daughter couldn’t figure it out until she was 4 and my son is just barely able to reach the pedals (3 years old) they do love the bike but I hate how long it is ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids have a hard time with this bike. My daughter couldn’t figure it out until she was 4 and my son is just barely able to reach the pedals (3 years old) they do love the bike but I hate how long it is between the seat and pedals for the kids
customer_reviews.author: Cristal Smith

customer_reviews.title: and easy to put together (and I’m not handy)
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping, clear directions, and easy to put together (and I’m not handy). Bought for my 2 1/2 year old son and he loves scooting himself around on it. He doesn’t quite understand the pedaling part quite yet, but the pedals are at a comfortable distance away for him. Other trikes we’ve tried out have been hard for him to reach. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew for his second birthday and he loves it! It was super easy to assemble and the adjustable seat is nice. My nephew is a bit short, so he can't quite reach the peddles yet, but he loves to scoot around on it! I can't wait until he's finally tall enough to use it right lol
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: great for our 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our son for his 2nd birthday. He's been beating on it and riding it for 6+ months and it has held up really well. We use it inside mostly, but we did play with it outside in the fall. The tires still look good even after being on concrete. The seat adjustment and pedal extenders are a nice feature to get more use out of this trike. Our two year old couldn't reach the pedals when he first got the trike, but now at 2.5 he can pedal with the extensions on. He is content to vroom it around with just his feet though. He rarely catches his heels on the back tires.
customer_reviews.author: blayne7

customer_reviews.title: This was soooo easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This was soooo easy to put together. It literally took us less than 10 minutes. I got this for my 20 month old son. Despite being tall for his age, he's still not quite tall enough to reach the pedals well enough to pedal; even with the extension blocks. Right now he's content to just push the ground with his feet. I imagine by his 2nd birthday he'll be big enough to ride it properly. I would recommend waiting until your kid at least 2 years old (especially if they're not tall for their age)
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Except for a small detail, lot of fun for your kids!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, feels initially weak but once you assemble it completely you will notice that the trike is really resistant and of good quality, baked by a prestigious brand like FisherPrice. I was expecting something a bit smaller, my 2.5y/o boy is not able to use it properly as he is probably short but he is having fun running all over the place with his trike so, don't hesitate!!! It's a great product for the price and seems to be really solid and safe.
customer_reviews.author: GP Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Steering is VERY tight on this.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I have a bad unit but once I put it together steering was very tight. Seems like the tolerances are off. I can't return since it was under the Tree. Maybe it will 'break-in' but so far its tough for my 3 year old to turn the steering.
customer_reviews.author: AWDV8

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Took some work to put together and the instructions helped with that. My 2yo is a bit too small for this still and can't reach the peddles, but he will grow into it. I should have looked into a metal bike, as this plastic wears in the sunlight (we leave it in the backyard). For the cost, it's a good trike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too big for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is very tall for his age (in the 96th percentile for height), and this trike is way too big for him, even with the seat all the way forward and the pedal extenders. This is advertised for 2-5 year olds, so I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Nails sent to assemble aren’t long enough.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the tricycle, I’m not a fan because I was sent nails that don’t fit into the portion that holds the front pedals together. I screwed then best I could and they’ve already come lose and it’s only been a day! Spend the extra and get a better trike. It’s a nice toy for my 3 year olds birthday but the assembly and nails really have me irritated with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Lundy

customer_reviews.title: This trike was great for my nephew
customer_reviews.text: This trike was great for my nephew! He could help but sit on his "motorcycle" once he seen it on Christmas Day, He grinned from ear to ear and since he is 2.5yrs old the pedal extenders were a must, but now he is "bruum-bruumin" around the playroom like he is the king of the road. It was worth every penny to see his face light up. Great product and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: DIY_Engineering

customer_reviews.title: great trike
customer_reviews.text: my three and a half year old loves this trike. very sturdy and goes everywhere. he doesn’t know how to pedal yet and his feet just reach (he’s very tall prob 80%ile for age) so i imagine this is best for the average four year olds to pedal on
customer_reviews.author: Moving_Forward

customer_reviews.title: Can't reach pedals
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice trike but pretty much useless. I bought this for my first kid and she was never able to reach the pedals. I thought maybe it was just her avoiding using them bc she was above 50th percentile for height. Now my second, who very much wants to keep up with her sister and pedal, can't reach either. The adjustable seat takes them farther from the pedals, not closer. To us, it's a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super cute durable first bike
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my four year old son for Christmas two years ago (he was two then). It is still in great condition despite him going on rides around the neighborhood 2-3 times a week for the last 2 years. The wheels can get a little slippery if he is going down a steep hill by himself, but it is not a huge thing. Easy to put together, super durable, fun little bike! Plus it looks cool, he calls it his motorcycle 😉
customer_reviews.author: Katy mohr

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere if your 2-5 year old isn’t. 3’6” tall
customer_reviews.text: Says from 2-5 yrs old. That must be a tall two year old. My 3 year old daughter can’t reach the pedals ((even with the extender) even after seat adjustment the pedals are too far away.... she’d need to wear thick shoes to make the difference. I should have just bought the the red trike.... disappointing
customer_reviews.author: EDDIEAM

customer_reviews.title: Well made--Grows with your child
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson's 3rd birthday--he's in the 90th percentile for height but his legs are just a touch too short to peddle yet--he loves scooting around the sidewalk on the trike, loves the colors, bike is sturdy and can be adjusted as he grows--he really loves his trike!
customer_reviews.author: Juneshamrock

customer_reviews.title: Great second birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson's second birthday, all though he hasn't figured out how to pedal quite yet, he loves pushing himself and his stuffed friends around on it. Easy to put together and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: anitaj

customer_reviews.title: Good starter trike
customer_reviews.text: It has some good features including adjustable seat and pedals. It has 2 problems: the front wheel has too much friction, and most of the kid's weight is over the rear wheels so the front wheel doesn't have much traction which isn't good because that's the driving wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bytheway

customer_reviews.title: they work great indoors or out
customer_reviews.text: Slightly too large for my two year old twin grands to peddle but they immediately jumped on and started pushing them around the house. Being plastic, they work great indoors or out. I especially like that they have a ring hole in rear that allows you to use a pushing device while the child is learning to ride. They are a little labor intensive to assemble but not overwhelming. I thought they were a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Cute but really big
customer_reviews.text: This trike is so cute and it was great for my 2yo son for Christmas but it was big for him and he's a big boy so it will probably be a few months before he can ride it really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Williams

customer_reviews.title: My kids LOVE their Fisher Price Grow with Me Trikes
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE their Fisher Price Grow with Me Trikes. My son is 18 months old so can't reach the pedals but walks it around to keep up with his 3 year old sister. She has a bicycle but also loves to play with this. Very lightweight so we put them in the trunk and travel with them to grandparents houses!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Carter

customer_reviews.title: Good buy. Not for under 3 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Not for kids under 3. My son is a taller almost 3 year old and his feet are finally almost resting on the pedals, but he still can't reach enough to comfortably pedal. Well constructed and a good buy for the price. Just patiently waiting until he can actually ride it, lol
customer_reviews.author: LILI

customer_reviews.title: should have a handle in back for those kids who ...
customer_reviews.text: should have a handle in back for those kids who don't know how to pedal yet. i wish i would have known. tried a makeshift handle but it doesn't work. so my son is not getting much use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leitner

customer_reviews.title: great little tricycle fairly easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: great little tricycle fairly easy to put together. My two-year-old is pretty short for his age so he has a hard time using it. it may not be best for kids under 3 but when he's big enough he's going to have a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... trike is cute but very lightweight and not as sturdy as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: This trike is cute but very lightweight and not as sturdy as I thought it would be. It's hard for my son to steer but he'll get better with practice. I should have broken down and gotten the pole that can attach to the back of the trike. It's just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Very tight steering.
customer_reviews.text: It steers like an old Dodge Dart with no power steering. My son is 2 years and 9 months and is in the 95th percentile in height, but even with the added foot blocks on it's a stretch to pedal. The wheels and the steering are way too tight. Takes a lot of effort to turn
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like others my kid can't reach the pedals
customer_reviews.text: Like others my kid can't reach the pedals, or at least couldn't when we first got it, but no matter he kicks this thing everywhere including the local skate parks! He loves this bike and has to ride it daily! In fact we are about ready to get him his second after dad had a garage mishap and crunched the tire a bit while it was parked.... uhg
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It took more time
customer_reviews.text: It took me longer to get it together than I thought and I still have not been able to get the extension for the pedals on but it is cute and she will grown to reach the pedals before summer is over I think.
customer_reviews.author: Kyhill/J

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Trike!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson wanted a big boy bike like his brother so Nana had to order this trike. He started using his feet to push it instead of the pedals but he is starting to get the hang of it now. The best thing about this trike is that it will grow with him. The seat moves as his legs get longer and the pedals get smaller as he figures out this riding thing. It is excellently made, sturdy and was super simple to assemble. A Great Product. I wish I could give it 10 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Caswell/Dollycas

customer_reviews.title: My kids (20MO) love these trikes
customer_reviews.text: My kids (20MO) love these trikes. They're still a little too short to reach the peddles even with the extensions so soon enough they should be even more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my 3 year old although he isn’t quite strong enough to move on his own yet.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  peddles probably work for a tall 2.5yr old ish.
customer_reviews.text: got this for my 2yr old's birthday. He can't reach the peddles. but he can run it like the Flintstones though! My 4yr old likes to ride it and it fits her quite well. My son rides it to the park and back (1/3 mile) with no problem. It's also very sturdy but light weight (some times he gets grandma to carry it back from the park while he walks and she has no problem.)
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Present - little large for 2 year old but think he will grow into by summer.
customer_reviews.author: Rita W.

customer_reviews.title: I have to say I was REALLY disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The wheels have no traction so it is hard for my grandson to ride this. The wheels want to turn and turn and not go anywhere. I have to say I was REALLY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Walker

customer_reviews.title: My son absolutely loves this tric only problem I have ...
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this tric only problem I have with it is my son can't reach the pedals even with the little helpers. He's 20 months old maybe I got it too soon, but I'm sure he will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Indigochild24

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My son is 16 months and loves to ride around the house or scoot around the house since he can’t rwach the pedals. I’m sure by the time he is 20 month he will be able to reach the pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 4 and still can reach the pedals and is cheaply made
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trike
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine. It's the fact that I was home and the carrier didn't even knock they scrapped it alone and put it by the door.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa diane landers

customer_reviews.title: this is great quality and not too difficult to put
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely loves this bike, he's 2 and can't quite reach the pedals yet but can use his feet on the ground and go just as fast. For the price, this is great quality and not too difficult to put together
customer_reviews.author: lexiip

customer_reviews.title: but it looked like it had never been unpackaged and everything was sealed ...
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES this little tricycle! I bought it "used", but it looked like it had never been unpackaged and everything was sealed and new.
customer_reviews.author: Anel Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this or my granddaughter and the way the seat vs pedals are set up even with the blocks she can't reach the pedals. This tricycle is not very stable. She is continuously tipping over. I would not recommend this product. It is going to become a yard ornament and I will be buying her a radio flyer tricycle.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed in this product. When I went to put one side of one of the back wheels together, I was not able to get the nut back off and ended up braking the toy. It was supposed to be my child’s big gift and I ended up having to toss it because I could not get it apart to fit back in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Logan

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Morning, my 2 year old hops on his ...
customer_reviews.text: Christmas Morning, my 2 year old hops on his first trike/bike. His feet could rest on pedal , but couldn't push it. He is in the 76th percentile and turned 2 days ago. We will scoot until he is taller. Otherwise it looks very kid friendly and not scary.
customer_reviews.author: Niki P

customer_reviews.title: I mean it's pretty simple to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The directions could be a little simpler. I mean it's pretty simple to assemble, or it should be. Just wish the directions weren't such a maze! Cute tricycle!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie R

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, not like older Fisher Price Trikes
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, it was easy to assemble. However its much more flimsier than previous fisher price trikes. My neighbor and I took our boys out for a walk, and my son kept trying to swap his trike for his friend's (which is an older, more solid FP trike than this model). If possible look for older Fisher Price trike on Craigslist rather than buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great little trike!
customer_reviews.text: Steering is a bit tight and even on the shortest setting my extra tall 2 year old can’t reach the pedals but that hasn’t stopped him from roaming all over the house on it!
customer_reviews.author: Moriah R.

customer_reviews.title: Wheels don't grip
customer_reviews.text: The wheels have little gripping ability. Tried inside on carpet and outside on sidewalk. The wheels just spin--requires a push to get it started.
customer_reviews.author: Severus Snape

customer_reviews.title: Great Trikes for My Twins
customer_reviews.text: We got these trikes for our two year old twins, and they love them. I will agree that they are a bit big for them, but we bought them expecting for them to have to grow into them. Even though they cannot always reach the pedals, they love chasing each other around and "triking" together. These are very sturdy, and a great value for the money we paid. As the product says, this trike will definitely "Grow with them."
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Twins

customer_reviews.title: Plastic cracks very easily, and everything doesn't fit together very well
customer_reviews.text: Plastic cracks very easily, and everything doesn't fit together very well. Although, my husband is the one who assembled it, so it may very well have been an operator error! But I can't tell. It keeps coming apart. Definitely do your research on this product.
customer_reviews.author: katherine

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Handle bars stiff and 1 pedal stuck
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. One Pedal wouldn’t turn freely and the steering was so tight it would be a miserable ride. The wheels had zero traction as well. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kersha

customer_reviews.title: Really nice product. Easy to put together an the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. Easy to put together an the price is great. My only complaint is that it is a bit too big for my 2.5 year old. The pedals are a bit far and does not reach, therefore he cannot use the pedals. He loves it though, and pushes on the floor to move around...
customer_reviews.author: NE Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful not to tighten the forks and steering column too tight or it is hard to pedal and turn. The plastic won't be flush, but the kids will be able to actually maneuver the trike. Other than that, it's a great little trike.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy!!! There are 2 options for placing the seat. My son is very tall, but is only 3. We put the seat in the second spot, so he could pedal comfortably. He got on it, and started to ride. It flipped backwards and he hit his back. Not a good bike!
customer_reviews.author: Christine A. Yacono

customer_reviews.title: Good starter.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it. Still doesn’t quite reach the pedals but that doesn’t stop him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: We leave it outside all the time and my son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Buckle 1500

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little trike
customer_reviews.text: 2 year old loves this more than his real bike. Awesome little trike!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good find!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would find a tryicycle this inexpensive. It's perfect for kids who are starting out with bicycle type toys and grows with your kid. It's very light weight and fun! Good find!
customer_reviews.author: Dora08

customer_reviews.title: still good, and my kid is a destroyer
customer_reviews.text: it can take a beating... still good , and my kid is a destroyer , strong build, easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: PHUCKobamaANDklinton

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I expected. My 3 years old daughter was very excited for this but when I assembled it was easy to assemble but its very hard to paddle it as the paddle is very far and is not very good designed. Its a design fault and every have to just use his legs to crawl by sitting on this trike. My daughter is not enjoying this and she almost left it kept in corner of house.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: FP Trike
customer_reviews.text: We bought this trike for our 2 year old for his birthday and he loves it! He hasn't quite gotten the concept of pedaling yet so he moves around with his feet on the ground (Fred Flinstone style) but he has a ball on it. My husband put it together and it wasn't the easiest thing in the world, but well worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodMama

customer_reviews.title: Love this little bike
customer_reviews.text: Love this little bike. My grandson is 27 months old. He cannot reach the pedals yet but he's learned how to turn the handles and rides it his way. He uses it in our house - down the hallway and into the kitchen. He loves it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably for 3+ years
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2-1/2 and in the 80th percentile for height and he still can't reach the pedals even with the pedal blocks on. I was pretty bummed that we'll have had this for a year before he can actually use it. It seems like it's nice and I'm sure my son will enjoy it more when it "fits"
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Stojevich

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure we will all like it fine
customer_reviews.text: It was very disappointing that even with the adjustable seat and wedges on the pedals, my 2 and a half year old grandson still cannot reach the pedals on he bike. Once he grows into it, I'm sure we will all like it fine. But do not buy it until your child is 3. He/she won't be able to pedal any of them. This is the second trike I have bought!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L. Hega

customer_reviews.title: Great trike!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Nice that it came with pedal extenders so my little one can reach the pedals. Sturdy tricycle, I think it'll hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mels_bells

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to pedal.
customer_reviews.text: Pedals and steering are tight and hard to move. I tried to loosen the bolts a bit but it didn't seem to help.
customer_reviews.author: MoMo

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice trike with some faults
customer_reviews.text: It is very long from the seat to the peddles. (Even with the added blocks) Because of this I would recomend it for a older toddler and it would be great. The assembly is a little more than expected as well. I bought this for a 2 1/2 year old girl who is tall for her age and she is not able to reach the peddles with blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: For a tall 3 year old or older
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trike, but be warned, not for a 2 year old or a small child. My daughter is tall for a 3 year old (about 39 inches) and if she was an inch or two shorter she would not reach the pedals at the closet setting and with the pedal things. It will last her for years to come which I like and you can't beat the price. Very easy to put together and seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Wheel won't stay on.
customer_reviews.text: The one rear wheel won't stay on. I don't know if it's a defective wheel or if it's missing a piece, but our toddler can't even push the trike across our small living room without the wheel falling off. We were so excited about this and he wants to ride it, but it just isn't safe.
customer_reviews.author: chris zona

customer_reviews.title: My greatGrandson adores his first trike and it looks good and is made tough or so it seems
customer_reviews.text: My greatGrandson adores his first trike and it looks good and is made tough or so it seems....we shall see as he uses it inside right now...We love it...:D
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Instructions totally stink, but bike is great. I run an in home childcare with 6 toddlers, this bike is ridden all day long
customer_reviews.author: Shelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Trike
customer_reviews.text: Our grandsons, ages 2 & 4, have really enjoyed the trike. The 2 yr old can't reach the pedals, but he zips along just fine using his feet on the ground. Looks like it will hold up quite well. It was easy for my husband to assemble. Arrived in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Gannaway

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and big
customer_reviews.text: I love this trike! My two year old is still to short to reach the pedals even with the pedal adapters. But he does love to scoot around the house. Its very sturdy and i feel like he will get atleast a few years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to Assemble (With Two People)
customer_reviews.text: My Toddler Loves it. Super easy to Assemble (With Two People), Wish it had some stickers thought its a bit plain.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! LOVE
customer_reviews.text: My little boy LOVES this bike! He is two and just starting to learn to actually peddle (still gets on it and just pushes with feet), but regardless is by far one of his favorite toys he has (and he has plenty!). I like that it can grow with the child with adjustable peddles and seat. Good quality product as well.
customer_reviews.author: H. N. Lombard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Christmas coalition child. Very easy to put together and he loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I think she will enjoy it much more when she's big enough to really ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old (in the 80th percentile for hight) can not reach the pedals yet, but she likes to scoot around on it using her feet on the floor. I think she will enjoy it much more when she's big enough to really ride it. But overal seems like a great value... strong and easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: JLeggette

customer_reviews.title: Great granddaughter is so excited
customer_reviews.text: So cute and not hard to assemble. Great granddaughter is so excited.
customer_reviews.author: STRAWBERRYBLONDE

customer_reviews.title: My son could not love this any more
customer_reviews.text: My son could not love this any more!!! He doesn't use the pedals though, at first our intention was to let him grow into it, but now that he's tall enough, he has discovered that it is still much faster to go with just his feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and the kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and the kids love it. The 2 year old can't quite peddle it yet but the 3 year old can reach just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made for kids with long legs!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my 1.5 year old, he couldn't reach the pedals but would ride it around with his feet on the ground. He still loves this at 2.5 years (still doesn't quite reach the pedals...almost) and I don't see him losing interest in it anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Erica L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It was easy to assemble and is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Nelly Simmons

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is average height and it’s still too big. It should be listed for older kids.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: He loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Feet could not reach the pedal but our grandson sat and pushed or walked fast (sitting). He loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: This trike was the perfect surprise for my 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: This trike was the perfect surprise for my 2 year old. While he can't quite reach the pedals yet, he enjoys chasing after his brother by pushing himself with his feet. This was a great purchase, especially as I couldn't find a trike around this price in stores near me!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend's son. He had been begging her for a new trike. They were blown away by how sturdy it is. He is almost 3, and can manage to reach he pedals. I do not recommend for short babies
customer_reviews.author: Caspergirl92

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little bike for the price! We let our son (he got it when he was 2, now he's 3, almost 4) ride it in the house (we live in Tanzania, it's a ranch with concrete floors). It's lasting great and steers and pedals very easily. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Momma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his trike, though his legs were not long enough to reach the peddles.
customer_reviews.author: Helene Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. Got it for my daughter for Christmas, seemed apartment friendly and it is. She rides it all the time, it's very sturdy but light. Perfect for what I was looking for, excited to take it outside when the weather warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Rkhale

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson really loves this bike. He is not yet able to reach the pedals but will be able to shortly. He is able to push himself around by foot. Easy to assemble and good quality. Really like the fact that the pedal blocks can be removed when he gets taller for longer use.
customer_reviews.author: loveabargain

customer_reviews.title: My 2 and 3 year old boys only think this ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 and 3 year old boys only think this is ok. The plastic wheels don't really let it get any traction so they can just spin around before they actually go anywhere. They usually pick there other bikes before this one.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike, so far so good. Our toddler cant quite reach the petals but he still uses the floor to race around. Easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bike for a toddler
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bike for a toddler. Kind of in between a tricycle and a big wheel. Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen F. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sturdy first trike
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and sturdy. It is still a bit too big for a rather tall two year old as far as reaching the pedals, but she scoots on it well and it won't be long until those toes touch
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

product_meta.title: Fisher-Price Grow-with-Me Trike,Grey
product_meta.description:
The Fisher-Price Grow-With-Me Trike has a two-position adjustable seat and removable pedal blocks that let it “grow” with your child for years of fun and adventure! Toddler friendly features help make this trike perfect for young riders, like a wide wheel base for stability, slip-resistant pedals, easy-grip handlebars, and durable tires for miles of smiles!

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Two-position adjustable seat lets this trike “grow” with kids for years of fun and adventure! With a wide wheel base for stability, slip-resistant pedals and easy-grip handlebars, and durable tires for miles of smiles.

See more
feature_bullets: Two-position adjustable seat for growing kids!
Removable pedal blocks for easy foot-to-pedal adjustment
